abstract.text: The device’s orientation relative to a known frame of reference at a point in time.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: class offers three different mathematical representations of attitude: a rotation matrix, a quaternion, and Euler angles (roll, pitch, and yaw values). You access
objects through the attitude property of each
objects passed to an application. An application starts receiving these device-motion objects as a result of calling the
Core Motion outputs a direction cosine matrix (DCM)—basically a rotation from the last “old” orientation to the new orientation of the device.

abstract.text: Process accelerometer, gyroscope, pedometer, and environment-related events.
The device’s orientation relative to a known frame of reference at a point in time.
Yields the change in attitude given a specific attitude.
The pitch of the device, in radians.
Returns a quaternion representing the device’s attitude.
The roll of the device, in radians.
Returns a rotation matrix representing the device’s attitude.
The yaw of the device, in radians.
Constants that indicate the frame of reference for attitude-related motion data.
Encapsulated measurements of the attitude, rotation rate, and acceleration of a device.
An object that starts and manages headphone motion services.
The object for starting and managing motion services.
Starts device-motion updates without a block handler.
Starts device-motion updates on an operation queue and using a specified block handler.
Starts device-motion updates using a reference frame but without a block handler.
Starts device-motion updates on an operation queue and using a specified reference frame and block handler.
The type for a quaternion representing a measurement of attitude.
The type of a structure representing a rotation matrix.
Retrieve motion data that the system processed to remove environmental bias, such as the effects of gravity.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
